thread.title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic opens up on his Manchester United future
thread.title_full: Zlatan Ibrahimovic opens up on his Manchester United future

title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic opens up on his Manchester United future
text:
Express Sport brings you 10 key statistics from Man United's win over Watford GETTY Zlatan Ibrahimovic has opened up on his Manchester United future GETTY Zlatan Ibrahimovic starred as Manchester United beat Watford on Saturday 
However, the 35-year-old has confirmed only he has the power to decide his future. 
"Nothing is done yet," Ibrahimovic told the Daily Mail . 
"Let's see what happens. 
"The option is already fulfilled from my side. We'll wait and see." GETTY Zlatan Ibrahimovic has hit 20 goals for Manchester United this season 
Ibrahimovic's words suggest he would be happy to stay at Old Trafford. 
However, should he opt to leave, he will be inundated with offers. 
Napoli and clubs from China and America have been backed to try and lure him away from the Premier League at the end of the season. Related articles
